website_summaries.verdict: Beautifully buffs with a long reach and with a variety of mediums.
pros: This unit is known to effectively repair car parts and provide cost-saving in the process
While small in stature, the sand blaster is reviewed as being able to reach sharp angles and maximize the use of the chosen media
cons: Can get a bit messy, so be sure to protect your face

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Works like a champ! I bought a glock years ago that someone had painted and it has looked like crap for years. I used this with just regular baking soda and a cheap harbor freight compressor and the results were exactly what I had hoped for. I had to let the compressor catch up every now and then because it stoped working very well under 70 psi, but that's my compressor's fault, not this thing's. Beats pay $100+ for the dedicated soda blasters I found online.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: It does a great job on small parts
customer_reviews.text: This sand blaster works! It does a great job on small parts. I assembled it per the directions, stuck the pickup tube in the blasting medium and went to work. It cleans every bit as well as the industrial strength unit my son works with on his job. This, however, is not an industrial scale unit. If you want to clean, for example, a truck frame, it'll do the job but it's going to take you a little bit of time and patience. But like I said, for small parts, it works very, very well. I've posted a couple of pictures. I hope this review helps.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great gun, for what I needed it for.
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a fab shop, but needed an inexpensive blaster for a Cerakote gun project I was working on. This gun did the trick. Great price. I followed the advice of another review to cut the siphon tube short and this seemed to help pick up blasting media more easily. I was using garnet sand #100 and worked well.
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Gets clogged unless you use a very fine particle of blasting medium
customer_reviews.text: Gets clogged unless you use a very fine particle of blasting medium. If you use anything nearly as coarse as regular sand, it clogs constantly. Also be prepared to hold the end of the hose that sucks up the medium as it is just rubber; if you place it into a bucket it will not continually feed.
customer_reviews.author: podunkbetty

customer_reviews.title: Works well as a replacement for my cheap Harbor Freight gun
customer_reviews.text: Bought a Harbor Freight cabinet blaster. It came with a gun that didn't work well from the get go. Kept clogging and the pickup tube found itself getting in the way over over again. A web search showed many ways to modify my cabinet, but they were costly. I decided to roll the dice and replace the gun and pickup tube. It works well and is much better quality.
customer_reviews.author: player

customer_reviews.title: blasting on the cheap
customer_reviews.text: I've used this a few times to blast rust & several coats of old paint from AC vents in my house. It works really well for the amount of money I paid for it. Worked so well that I could refurbish my original steel vents at a cheaper price (including price of this blaster + the grit) than buying now ones. My only complaint is that the hose would sometimes cake up and get blocked, but I think that has more to do with the humid climate and my lack of an inline drier. I would definitely buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: sydneydanny

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job
customer_reviews.text: I've had this 3 years and it does a great job for the handful of times I've used it. Mostly clean up some steel rims and one larger project, and I just used plain sand that I screened myself with an old window screen. However I just saw it on the shelf today and the hose is completely shot (half disintegrated and full of holes). Kinda disappointed for only 3 years and being stored in a cool dry place. Overall it works good at a great price. Think I'll just cut a piece of garden hose for it when I need it again
customer_reviews.author: MK & RK

customer_reviews.title: Easy way to get started!
customer_reviews.text: I got this to be able to etch glassware without having to use the cremes and I am in love with how easy it is to get stared. All you do is hook it to a compressor and stick the other end in a bag of play sand and you're good to go. I just used a small compressor and had no issues with adjusting. I was worried it would be too much power for wine glasses, but as long as you hold the nozzle far enough away you should have no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Jessilen

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for walnut blasting my BMW's intake valves
customer_reviews.text: It worked way better than the $20 harbor freight special I first tried. It had a hopper on the top. It was garbage for walnut media. This Sandblaster worked amazing! I had to make a long tube to fit through the vacuum adapter and into the valve port. Can be seen in the pic. It was a $1.39 1/4" piece of plastic water pipe with two 1/4" copper crimp lugs on it with a little aluminum foil tape over them. Worked like a charm!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: JUNK!
customer_reviews.text: So there it is! One hour of fighting with this blaster and this is ALL it accomplished! To say this is Junk is an understatement, this is ABSOLUTELY the WORST tool I’ve ever purchased and that’s after 40 years in autobody repair! Any positive reviews should be dismissed as paid for propaganda by this seller and nothing more. Dry clean air at 150 psi and 80 grit dry sifted blasting sand was used so there’s only one possibility
customer_reviews.author: GAR212

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I use this to clean the calcium build up on the pool tiles. I had previously used a larger more expensive system from harbor freight but the hose on the harbor freight tool dry rotted in less then 2 years. This tool worked great and was simple to use. Simple and inexpensive. Make sure you buy the glass beads if your working on a pool or similar project so you don't scratch up the tiles
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Danger

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Testing different grades of sand to determine which is best to remove old powder coating from aluminum wheels. So far, the fine grit sand mixed with sifted river sand works the best. Not a professional unit to be sure, but after I used previous users advice and shortened the length of hose, it worked great. Would recommend to others!
customer_reviews.author: scott g boothe sr

customer_reviews.title: Good for the little stuff
customer_reviews.text: For the money it's ok. Definitely just for the small project. I used it to blast the hard to get to places on my Jeep body and it got the job done though it is pretty slow. Maybe better media would be better. Still have a little more to do, maybe I will buy some black beauty and see how that goes. Use only good dry media or you will be stopping constantly to clean it out.
customer_reviews.author: H. L. Overton

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Needs a good size compressor unless u r ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Needs a good size compressor unless u r working on small projects. For the money... I love it. I put my blast media in those plastic 5-gal buckets and simply place the tube in the bucket. That simple. Use a bucket lid to keep moisture out when storing the media. Now I have 3 different buckets with various blast media ready to go. Just walk the bucket and hose to an area of the property u don’t mind getting “dirty”.
customer_reviews.author: Music Man

customer_reviews.title: Terrible performance. Just barely moved abrasive 10% of time.
customer_reviews.text: I would leave a zero if I could. Useless. Maybe mine defective looking at other good reviews. Tried with 100# abrasive only moved media about 10% of the time. Tried lifting bucket media above nozzle. Different pressures. Nothing helped. I have huge compressor with dryer on it so lots of air. Had to give up and use a wire wheel. I ve had this type before (not this brand) with good results.
customer_reviews.author: David Noakes

customer_reviews.title: If you've never used a powder blaster try this out first.
customer_reviews.text: I used this powder blaster to clean up some cabinets before painting, I used baking soda as a medium and this unit worked great. My compressor only generated 100psi. I tried Epsom salts as a blasting medium but being coarser it clogged in the line. I did not see replacement nozzles offered with this unit, maybe I missed that information. Great first sand blaster. I don't believe I saw a "Wrench" included as is shown on the description of this item.
customer_reviews.author: Bob C.

customer_reviews.title: Replacement for HF blast cabinet
customer_reviews.text: Great replacement for the gun in my 40 lb. HF sandblast cabinet. Got it faster and probably for less money than a replacement from HF. Works awesome and seems to use less air. I believe the nozzles I sourced for the HF (not easy) will work in this. Haven't used it as a stand alone blaster but I can't imagine running it with less than a 3 HP compressor. My unit was down got this in 4 days. Don't recall if it was Prime but it seems that Prime 2 day shipping is turning into 4 day shipping. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Just a guy

customer_reviews.title: “ as good or better...”
customer_reviews.text: I received this the day after it was ordered and immediately put to work. The unit is very well constructed and the operation was simple. Plenty of line was provided and in my situation with my compressor this provided as good or better than my sandblaster has ever worked. I had a concern that it would be lightweight materials that would not last but I was pleasantly surprised and pleased that I saved money not buying the higher priced.
customer_reviews.author: Sarman

customer_reviews.title: little power out of this unit especially with a smaller air compressor
customer_reviews.text: i use a 21 gal 2.5 horse Harbor Freight compressor and it didnt blast much sand with this kit. this may work much better with a more beefy compressor but if you are above the hobby arena and need to sandblast either have it done or invest in a pro grade sandblaster.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Just WOW!!
customer_reviews.text: I really can't believe just how simple this thing works. I'm using baking soda to strip a motorcycle frame. Adjusted the compressor to 90 lbs. then shoot. I did find out the hard way, goggle and a face shield are needed. If it's cool enough, even a cheap plastic painters one piece clothes will keep 10 lbs of baking soda off you. This thing is worth gold!
customer_reviews.author: Willee

customer_reviews.title: I recommend sanding the flat areas and just using this corners ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this for soda blasting to remove the finish from only furniture. I works but it's slow and uses a lot of soda. I recommend sanding the flat areas and just using this corners and crevices. This is an effective tool and very economical if you already have an air compressor.
customer_reviews.author: scrognoid

customer_reviews.title: Works great. I use the compressor at work though @ ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I use the compressor at work though @ 100psi / 100 cfm... It's a beast. Not sure how well it'd work on a smaller compressor - 5-10cfm range which might be the average of most users air supply...
customer_reviews.author: Joshua J Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I had low expectations because of the price but I figured for 16 bucks why not. The thing works surprisingly well even though it's runing off a little compressor with a 10 gallon air tank. So far i've only used it to cleanup a set of brake calipers and the blade spindles from my lawnmower, but if you're like me and you try to rebuild your car parts instead of just replacing the whole thing, this is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: PBJ

customer_reviews.title: DIY blast cabinet
customer_reviews.text: Good quality gun, but replacement nozzles are hard to find. Only one per package for $11?! (MP310900AV) I will buy the gun that takes the pink nozzles next time.
customer_reviews.author: ACK

customer_reviews.title: This thing does not put out much sand even using super fine sand
customer_reviews.text: Finally got around to using it. Air leaks from the body of the handle. This thing does not put out much sand even using super fine sand. My compressor is plenty capable so that's not the issue. I would send the product back if possible. Would appreciate a refund.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Long life
customer_reviews.text: Very durable. I used this to replace the one in my blast cabinet and so far it has held up 10 times longer than the two others I tried.
customer_reviews.author: paul e dell

customer_reviews.title: Works like a champ
customer_reviews.text: High quality item. Works like a champ. I wish they had added some ceramic tips. Only comes with one, so go ahead and get more when you buy it. the hose is very long and flexible. I decided to cut mine in half, so I would not have to worry about it getting in my way. Again, the best thing is IT WORKED. cheapo-depo brands let you down every time.
customer_reviews.author: tracy allen

customer_reviews.title: good choice for the DIY person who might have a ...
customer_reviews.text: This is inexpensive, but it worked well. good choice for the DIY person who might have a couple of small projects, and not yet know that sandblasting is a PITA and should be left to professionals who have protective gear and a cabinet to contain and catch all the grit.
customer_reviews.author: J. Schaeffer

customer_reviews.title: Simply worked very well. I sprayed at 35PSI some ...
customer_reviews.text: Simply worked very well. I sprayed at 35PSI some aluminum pistons for coatings. I used 125 grit aluminum oxide. Since I used low air pressure, I used a shorter hose. The hose is just standard 1/2 inch rubber hose. I sprayed into an old cat litter box with high sides. That caught some grit, but a lot of grit blows everywhere. I was thinking you could spray grit on top of a plastic tarp, then collect for reuse.
customer_reviews.author: sdowney717

customer_reviews.title: Once you fiddle around with it it works fine. I got sand from Homedepot
customer_reviews.text: Once you fiddle around with it it works fine. I got sand from Homedepot, get the pre-dried stuff. Wet sand will clog it. I cut ~3 feet out of the house. Works best when sand is at same level as the work. Will not work well if the work is elevated more than a few feet
customer_reviews.author: K. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Very useful for the price
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of experimentation determining what system worked best for soda blasting. This did the best job and was easiest to unclog even though it was very inexpensive. Just make sure you have a compressor about 15 cfm or better.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Campbell

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: I was using dried sifted playground sand and just struggled with keeping the sand coming up the hose. As long as you can keep sand coming to the nozzle works great.
customer_reviews.author: william

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to clean the rust off my truck doors to hopefully hold off total rot. I used a Porter-Cable 3.5 Gallon Portable Air Compressor the pancake style, this severed the job well. i got down to bare metal quickly. I did not have any moisture filter or anything. I used Quikrete fine sand, I only had one small pebble in the part of the bag I used. the bag was under 6.00 at HD. Overall very happy!
customer_reviews.author: ZZ35mm/digital

customer_reviews.title: Worked as edpected
customer_reviews.text: This worked as expected, it's not a large blaster and can't be used to do a huge project but works fine for smaller projects. I used play sand after screening and drying it, filled a bucket and was able to use 30 pounds to clean a frame for my Model T. I reccommend you not try to use this for any extended period if you have a smaller oilless compressor, you'll want to use a larger compressor if you don't want to burn up the motor. Overall I am happy and would recommend the product for anyone who doesn't expect it to be a point and shoot industrial sand blaster.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: no replacement nozzles available
customer_reviews.text: Don't bother with this gun, after a week you'll need to replace it, because there's no nozzles available.
customer_reviews.author: BG

customer_reviews.title: Harbor Freight replacement
customer_reviews.text: I bought a harbor freight cabinet and then after getting frustrated with the gun went to Amazon to find a replacement. I bought this because of the other HF reviews and it works so much better. Thanks to everyone that left HF comments.
customer_reviews.author: J. Nolen

customer_reviews.title: Works okay.  Blast media delivery somewhat inconsistent.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't expect all that much from such a simple device but it worked okay. The delivery of dry commercial soda is a bit inconsistent but itgot the job done. I used it at 90 PSI with Armex soda.
customer_reviews.author: D. Joseph Hargrave

customer_reviews.title: Works great.  Not for big jobs
customer_reviews.text: CH AT1266 sandblaster works great. It does not have enough power with my compressor to do large areas but fine for anything less than say 3ft by 3ft. Use dry media! Sieve media before use (I used aluminum window screen which is a bit too big but OK for what I was doing, I used fine beach sand as media). Follow directions! Hose must not be pushed onto metal media feed pipe so far that it blocks air flow down outside of double pipe otherwise media will not feed properly. Wear proper breathing mask and face protection! Silicosis is not a thing to be trifled with.
customer_reviews.author: Hardware Junk

customer_reviews.title: useful
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to clean up my curb from previously painted addresses. The old rectangle was too wide, and didn't leave a top nor bottom gap. This kit fixed that up just great. The curb now looks like it's supposed to. My air compressor couldn't keep up, so I had to take frequent breaks. Also, I live in the Southwest with very low humidity. There wasn't an issue with condensate during this job. It took about 30 minutes total, including filtering the sand through a window screen.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Why not?  Get one.
customer_reviews.text: It works well with black diamond to remove light rust. Be prepared to work slowly. Does not do well on powdercoat. Minimum of a 20 gallon unit to function. I would recommend for small jobs or hobby.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Holy grail of affordable diy sandblasting!
customer_reviews.text: This blasting gun works like a beast!!! I used it with my trusty Crafstman 33 Gallon Compressor without problems arising. Obviously, it was hard for my compressor to keep up with the CFM demands of sandblasting. However, it does work, and works well! I have used this to strip paint off of parts such as valve covers, coolant necks, and all sorts of things. Blasting soda, and this thing are friends.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Pinkham

customer_reviews.title: I am amazed at how well baking soda works to clean without ...
customer_reviews.text: I am amazed at how well baking soda works to clean without damaging. Cleans up painted or powder coated surfaces and no scuffing to the paint. Just awesome cleaning aluminum suppressors. Makes the baffles shiny without damaging like chemicals or tumbling can do. Note: if you use this with baking soda, don't do it in your yard if you have grass...
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I have a cheap Harbor Freight blast cabinet that I couldn't get to siphon media. My air pressure was fine and I took the gun apart to clean it and still nothing. I gave up and bought this gun. Works great now.
customer_reviews.author: Saltdog

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the job
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought this for his renovation project on his 1996 Chevy Silverado. It was easy to use and it did a beautiful job removing rust and paint.
customer_reviews.author: Morralm

customer_reviews.title: WOW, great gun for a great price.
customer_reviews.text: I just replaced my HF gun with this one and WOW what a difference. I am using this inside a cabinet and it works GREAT. It comes with a very long hose so you can use it in a bucket if you want. I cut the hose to use it in the cabinet. It sprays a lot of material and hasn't gunked up on me yet. Very good quality gun for a great price. You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: Did a great job, used Walnut shells on an intake manifold. Kept pressure low, under recommended, to be safe. Only had a few feed problems. Gun was easy to control.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat it for the price
customer_reviews.text: Cranked my compressor up to 90 PSI and it works great for the price. Like others, I cut the feed hose to about 5 feet to get a good flow of sand. Be sure to get a positive pressure mask to protect yourself from Silicosis...a bad way to die.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Glad i got it.
customer_reviews.text: Love this simple easy to use sandblaster. Get a bucket of dry sand , stick the metal tipped hose in and go. I have a 110 lb red one that clogs every 5 seconds and this one is way better. Not made to blast a whole car but for small stuff . A couple of time the hose came out and fell in the dirt it still was working picking up sand of the ground. I have even used soda with it.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: This tool isn't designed for large jobs but great for small areas
customer_reviews.text: This is a very handy tool and is very inexpensive. Make sure you have a compressor that can keep up. I use it for removing light to medium dust on various surfaces. This tool isn't designed for large jobs but great for small areas.
customer_reviews.author: ct101

customer_reviews.title: Worked as expected.
customer_reviews.text: This did a good job and worked as expected. Able to use this with an air compressor and 5 gallon bucket to spray blasting media and remove surface rust without any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I used this to soda blast - worked great on small parts (I just used the baking soda ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this to soda blast - worked great on small parts (I just used the baking soda you can buy at the store - not real soda blasting material) - It did not take off heavily soiled material
customer_reviews.author: G34

customer_reviews.title: OUTSTANDING
customer_reviews.text: WONDERFUL TOOL THAT REQUIRES AIR COMPRESSOR.. THIS IS A SANDBLASTNG MONSTER WITH THE CORRECT MEDIA AND PROPER AIR DELIVERY.
customer_reviews.author: J. SILVESTRI

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic! I used to have a blast cabinet that ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! I used to have a blast cabinet that was terrible. It never worked right, drove me nuts and took up a lot of room. I was skeptical on this item even with all the positive reviews. Well this blew me away. I could not believe how well it worked. The quickrete play sand works great, just make sure to screen it first. Do not pass this one up. This gun is great!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Fitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: I researched small sand blasters for two weeks and all ...
customer_reviews.text: I researched small sand blasters for two weeks and all of the reviews pointed to this one. I haven't used it yet but I was impressed with the quality right out of the box. The Amazon price was the absolutely the lowest around. If brand matters to you I have a Campbell Hausfeld tankless air compressor that is going on 20 years old and I have had to replace nothing on it, I still use the original air house!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Martin

customer_reviews.title: Nothing Fancy
customer_reviews.text: It's a low end gun but it works OK. For small stuff. Occasional use. Not an every day gun but it's priced accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and great price
customer_reviews.text: I almost bought one of these from Harbor freight figuring it would be cheaper and good enough for what I needed it for. But this one is of a much higher quality and half the price of Harbor freight’s.
customer_reviews.author: G B

customer_reviews.title: Works great. I've used both aluminum oxide and quickcreate playsand ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this to etch small art projects...glasses and such. Works great. I've used both aluminum oxide and quickcreate playsand without any problems. I use this with a 6 gallon 165 PSI compressor. This size of compressor works for the small projects I do, but would need a larger one if you plan on sandblasting anything bigger than a glass or handheld mirror.
customer_reviews.author: Tinkerpunked

customer_reviews.title: Did what I needed it to
customer_reviews.text: I used this to sandblast the rust on the inner rear fenders on my pickup. It worked very well for that. Don't know how well it would work on a bigger job. Definitely need eye and mouth protection.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Worked great to remove old pain from a wicker chair set
customer_reviews.text: Worked great to remove old pain from a wicker chair set. I used fine walnut shell media purchased from Harbor Freight to do the work. I saw several good reviews on this unit, and I used it just as it was shipped (did not cut the feeding hose) and it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Pops

customer_reviews.title: Great blaster
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. Easy to use. Buy a good, it will help and be safer for the eyes.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: No hose
customer_reviews.text: Shows it with the siphon hose in the picture, I didn't get one.
customer_reviews.author: BuyBuyBuy!

customer_reviews.title: Eats through rust with the right kind of media blast.
customer_reviews.text: I would suggest this sandblaster for any DIY'er. It's purpose is to be used on small projects. However, I am in the process of using it to blast the chassis my VW resto with no problems or clogging. I would also suggest using "Blackdiamond" media blast. My local northern tool has 50lb bags for 8 bucks. I tried screening playsand, but it wasn't worth the hassle. This kit and a great price on media blast has saved me lots of money and hours of time trying to wirewheel the rust off. I use a 5.5 cfm 30 gallon Husky compressor and it keeps up fine.
customer_reviews.author: Praytrade

customer_reviews.title: Great Blast Gun
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice blasting gun. However it comes with only one tip. I found that I can get spare Ceramic Nozzle Kits from Sears Parts on line: [...] Campbell Hausfeld Ceramic Nozzle Kit
customer_reviews.author: Thomas D.

customer_reviews.title: No nozzles available.
customer_reviews.text: No replacement nozzles are available, and the one supplied is the wrong size for what I'm doiig.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't expect much from this product considering its simplicity and price, but it does what it claims to do. I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: James E. Knight

customer_reviews.title: Basic, can be a good thing.
customer_reviews.text: It works! My initial use is very encouraging, the next time I'll try with my better compressor. I don't think there are any negative issues, it's very straightforward and instructions explained safety precautions well.
customer_reviews.author: Agelon T. Jones

customer_reviews.title: It worked somewhat for a couple of minutes. The ...
customer_reviews.text: It worked somewhat for a couple of minutes. The hose plugs, even with dry sand. After a number of attempts after cleaning the hose, and wasting hours, I quit the job. After reading these comments, I see that I am not the only one with this problem...not shooting sand!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hose clogs up quick..
customer_reviews.text: Not worth what you pay for it, didn’t suck the dryest and finest of sands. Hose clogs up quick..
customer_reviews.author: Grizzalee

customer_reviews.title: Buy this!!
customer_reviews.text: All tool shops need this!! Make sure your sand is dry and finely filtered. I use it with a 5 gallon compressor and it works perfect for moderate tools. Get a separator to go with it. Best way to have sandblasting a home. Can't say enough good things. Price is amazing too!!
customer_reviews.author: redhog

customer_reviews.title: Product works well with fine blasting medium
customer_reviews.text: Product works well with fine blasting medium. 1/2" ID rubber hose flexible and easy to hook up. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: W_Parmantie

customer_reviews.title: Best Sand blasting gun for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect. Used aluminum oxide to blast my firearms and came out exactly how I needed it.
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: VERY VERY HAPPY
customer_reviews.text: Easy as PIE... I used this to prep some small aluminum parts for painting... used medium grit aluminum oxide that came in a small plastic bucket... basically just stick the hose down in the bucket and go at it... ZERO issues. Easy to assemble and set up. Allowed me to work over a plastic tote so I could recover most of my media and rescreen it.
customer_reviews.author: mountaineer

customer_reviews.title: GOOD BUY
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good tool for the price. Worked well, slow going but it works. Will remove paint and light rust. Not powerful enough for heavy-scale rust. Don't forget to buy a water-oil separator filter to avoid clogs in the pick-up tube.
customer_reviews.author: D. SULLIVAN

customer_reviews.title: I think better results could be achieved with a better spray gun ...
customer_reviews.text: Works reasonably well. I strained some play sand and left it next to a dehumidifier for a week to dry it out. I think better results could be achieved with a better spray gun and media, but for the cost it got the job done.
customer_reviews.author: CBU

customer_reviews.title: ... came with a gun already in it - it sucked. So
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of those cabinets from Harbor Freight that came with a gun already in it - it sucked. So, I picked this up and switched it out and it is MUCH, MUCH better!
customer_reviews.author: StrattAg21

customer_reviews.title: Rugged, not expensive and has a long lasting ceramic nozzle
customer_reviews.text: fine quality and a good price. Has a nice long lasting ceramic nozzle and solidly built metal body. I broke a unit from HV because it was plastic. This one is very good.
customer_reviews.author: John Webshopper

customer_reviews.title: better than harbor freight.
customer_reviews.text: works better then the harbor freight gun that was in the used cabinet I bought.
customer_reviews.author: only in Cleveland

customer_reviews.title: clogs at the stock tubing length frequently using the black ...
customer_reviews.text: clogs at the stock tubing length frequently using the black abrasive medium media. not sure if i would order if i knew what i know now
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Used only once and the black suction hose basically deteriorated. Cracks , cracks, and more cracks.
customer_reviews.author: J.E.C.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: nice add on to my air compressor works as both, power wash / detergent gun or sand blaster.
customer_reviews.author: Rimma

customer_reviews.title: does what it said it can
customer_reviews.text: for the money it did the job. nicely for me to remove rust from car doors.
customer_reviews.author: Charles G.

customer_reviews.title: Worth it. Just pick the media that matches your needs.
customer_reviews.text: Great value. I'm using walnut shells to gently strip some aluminum wheels. Has worked better than expected, and the cost to do this yourself is so small. Just invest in some masks and goggles and ear protection, or a hood. Otherwise you'll be blowing walnut shells out of your nose for a week.
customer_reviews.author: J. Brett Howell

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what it needs to do...
customer_reviews.text: Gun works well but coudlnt get it to use it long enough since my air compressor is not adequate for this application. Air compressor size is crucial in sand blasting!! Product is so simple that if something doesnt go right, most likely something wrong with your setup.
customer_reviews.author: Ruger

customer_reviews.title: and it works fine without having to shorten the suction hose
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Am using coal slag through it and it works well. My compressor only puts out around 11 cfm, and it works fine without having to shorten the suction hose. The only issue I have is that the suction hose it difficult to attach to the gun correctly. It really took some effort to get it all the way on. Other than that, it's a great product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Licher

customer_reviews.title: Awsome way better then the gun one that hold sand.
customer_reviews.text: This works way better then the blue plastic gun one.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg D.

customer_reviews.title: Very Handy
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you use fine graded sand. Works great for small surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Good for smaller projects.
customer_reviews.text: Not too bad for a suction feed and good for smaller projects. I used it to strip some jeep wheels but I wouldn't try anything larger than that.
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, simple, reliable, and works quite well.
customer_reviews.text: When moisture begins to cause the sand to clog the venturi, it's very simple to unscrew the collar that holds the nozzle and blow out the damp sand with an air nozzle. Two thumbs up! (Be prepared for lots of sand all over the place where you sandblast....we do it outside.)
customer_reviews.author: Paul A. Skinner

customer_reviews.title: This did the trick for media blasting a door. ...
customer_reviews.text: This did the trick for media blasting a door. We did soda blasting with it...but because of the humidity outside, it would clog a few times. However, it didn't take long to clear at all. For the price and my projects it was totally worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: marchloe

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool, quality & great price
customer_reviews.text: Replacing factory blast cabinet gun & this one is light years ahead of the one that came with the cabinet, I love this one.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: SOMETHING THAT WORKS
customer_reviews.text: THIS DOES NOT WORK .IT WOULD SPRAY OUT FOR 3 SECONDS AND THEN CLOG I EVEN INCREASED THE PRESSURE AND KEPT THE SUSTION LINE STRAIGHT. SPENT MONEY ON THE SANDBLASTING MATERIAL AND EVEN A DRIER ON MY COMPRESSOR TO KEEP MATERIAL FROM GETTING MOIST . NOW I GUESS I WILL HAVE TO A WIRE WHEEL WILL BE SANDING THIS BACK VERRY UNHAPPY .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... every trick that was suggested but this thing still sucks and not the sand i was using
customer_reviews.text: I tryed every trick that was suggested but this thing still sucks and not the sand i was using. Look for one with pink tips i bought one of those and it worked.
customer_reviews.author: BK

customer_reviews.title: this product worked great for about 30 minutes now I can get the ...
customer_reviews.text: this product worked great for about 30 minutes now I can get the sand to come up the vacuum tube. Have even shortened cord and tried everything different and bigger compressor some with water filters and some without gonna just throw it away.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Sabo

customer_reviews.title: Works great, even better price!
customer_reviews.text: Great product, even better price. Wanted to blast my S&W Shield 9mm slide to make it a 2 tone. Tried walnut shell 1st, didn't even touch it. Found out you need glass beads. Worked GREAT!
customer_reviews.author: Nathan B.

customer_reviews.title: A bargain at twice the price!
customer_reviews.text: This tool is an excellent value. I've used it on two small projects and it performed flawlessly, I've already put 25 pounds of fine mesh coal slag abrasive through it with no problems whatsoever. The ceramic nozzle shows no sign of wear and it has yet to clog or malfunction.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Sue Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: I have had one just like it for quite some time
customer_reviews.text: Yes it did, however it was ordered by mistake! I have had one just like it for quite some time. Works very well. Was looking for one more compact for touching up stainless steel gun barrels.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Bircher

customer_reviews.title: Well made unit
customer_reviews.text: Nice and solidly built. Worked first try hooking it up to a borrowed air compressor. Great for sandblasting some old furniture to get the varnish off.
customer_reviews.author: W. Gervasi

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It works pretty good. Make sure the sand is FINE
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Great product, esspecially considering the price. Have run it hard between 70 and 105 psi. Attached a harbor freight water separator and have had no issues with clogging. Using it in a basement in Georgia. Average humidity is above 80%.
customer_reviews.author: ReservoirDawg

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfect stores easily away
customer_reviews.text: Work like a champ and stores easily. A good buy
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Davis

product_meta.title: Sand Blaster with 10 Foot Hose, Sand Blast Gun, and Wrench - Siphon Feed (Campbell Hausfeld AT122601AV)
product_meta.description:
Color:Original versionSand Blaster with 10 Foot Hose, Sand Blast Gun, and Wrench - Siphon Feed (Campbell Hausfeld AT122601AV)

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Sandblasting kit. Includes: Sandblast gun with ceramic nozzle, 10-Feet hose, steel pick-up tube and Allen wrench.
feature_bullets: 10-ft. hose draws abrasive from bucket or bag, leaving a satin finish ready for paint or further pre-treatment
The siphon-feed spray gun is designed to deliver most abrasives including glass beads, aluminum oxide, steel grit, silicon carbide, walnut shells and more
The versatile AT122601AV sand blaster can be used in craft work to etch glass and weather wood
Includes: Sandblast gun with ceramic nozzle, 10-Feet hose, steel pick-up tube and Allen wrench
Finish your projects faster and easier with Campbell Hausfeld - The Air Power Expert
